publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-4001 Ms Sandra White: GreenCity Wholefoods 25th Anniversary-That the Parliament congratulates GreenCity Wholefoods workers' co-operative based in Dennistoun, Glasgow, on reaching its 25th anniversary, which it is celebrating in May 2003; notes that GreenCity Wholefoods is a non-exploitative workplace that takes into consideration the interests of workers, the community and the environment as a whole, and wishes continued success to GreenCity in its activities of supplying natural foods throughout Scotland.

S1M-4001 Ms Sandra White: GreenCity Wholefoods 25th Anniversary-That the Parliament congratulates GreenCity Wholefoods workers' co-operative based in Dennistoun, Glasgow, on reaching its 25th anniversary, which it is celebrating in May 2003; notes that GreenCity Wholefoods is a non-exploitative workplace that takes into consideration the interests of workers, the community and the environment as a whole, and wishes continued success to GreenCity in its activities of supplying natural foods throughout Scotland.
S1M-4001 GreenCity Wholefoods 25th Anniversary (lodged on 6 March 2003) Michael Matheson*
S1M-4001 GreenCity Wholefoods 25th Anniversary (lodged on 6 March 2003) Donald Gorrie*, Kay Ullrich*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-4001 GreenCity Wholefoods 25th Anniversary (lodged on 6 March 2003) Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-4001 GreenCity Wholefoods 25th Anniversary (lodged on 6 March 2003) Linda Fabiani*, Christine Grahame*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-4001 GreenCity Wholefoods 25th Anniversary (lodged on 6 March 2003) Robert Brown*
S1M-4001 GreenCity Wholefoods 25th Anniversary (lodged on 6 March 2003) Alex Neil*
S1M-4001 GreenCity Wholefoods 25th Anniversary (lodged on 6 March 2003) Robin Harper*

S1M-4001 Ms Sandra White: GreenCity Wholefoods 25th Anniversary—That the Parliament congratulates GreenCity Wholefoods workers’ co-operative based in Dennistoun, Glasgow, on reaching its 25th anniversary, which it is celebrating in May 2003; notes that GreenCity Wholefoods is a non-exploitative workplace that takes into consideration the interests of workers, the community and the environment as a whole, and wishes continued success to GreenCity in its activities of supplying natural foods throughout Scotland. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Donald Gorrie, Kay Ullrich, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Gil Paterson, Linda Fabiani, Christine Grahame, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Robert Brown, Alex Neil, Robin Harper, Irene McGugan*
